results.brief_description: An introduction to the game of chess, sponsored by the Australian Chess Academy, under the supervision of champion chess player Gregory Koshnitsky.

results.title: 800 miles of winter (TEFC)
results.brief_description: From the discovery of oil at Prudhoe Bay in 1968 to the loading of the first tankers at Valdez in 1977, this is the story of one of the most difficult and costly construction projects ever attempted. Almost 800 miles of big pipe was laid across three major mountain ranges and Arctic perma-frost, to reach an ice free port in south east Alaska. (Award: Golden Eagle, USA)

results.title: 2am feeding
results.brief_description: This film is a realistic look at parenting during the first few months after birth. It touches on a wide range of parental concerns, such as nursing, crying and colic, fatigue, mother’s recovery, sexuality, fathering, single parenthood, and returning to work. The film is straight forward, presenting a diverse group of new parents who relate their experiences with warmth and humour. Narrated by Robbie Engelmann.

results.title: 1989 Redex Variety Club Bash
results.brief_description: Adventurer, Dick Smith, began the Bash in 1985 and since then it has grown to be one of the largest fund-raising events anywhere in the world. It is uniquely Australian. A drive in the Outback with a few mates, which at the same time helps raise money for less fortunate children. The 1989 Bash went from the South East of Australia across three States and the Northern Territory, to the North-West of the Continent, an epic 12 day, 1,600 kilometre drive. All vehicles taking part had to be built before 1966. 208 cars and nearly 1,000 people took part in the Bash and raised over two million dollars for the Variety Club of Australia, and all that money will go towards helping handicapped or underprivileged children throughout Australia.

results.title: 1976 kayak canoe Olympics. No. 13
results.brief_description: Part thirteen of a series which record the last three days of heats, repercharges and semi-finals of the 1976 Olympic Canoe and Kayak races in Montreal, 1976. Excellent for stroke analysis and coaching, as it includes slow motion close-ups of the best paddlers in the world. The 500m and 1000m finals are shown. Photographed by Dr. Stan Plagenhoef.

results.title: 13th World Jamboree
results.creator_credit: Yoshifuru Takeichi, Takeshi Hojo and Nikkei Films
results.brief_description: The founder of scouting, Lord Baden Powell, was most impressed by Japan, and sixty years later the 13th World Jamboree was held on foothills of Mt. Fuji. Scouts from all over the world occupied seven thousand multicoloured tents for nine days. The theme was: “For Understanding” and to bring this about scouts demonstrated their various skills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yoshifuru Takeichi, Takeshi Hojo and Nikkei Films

results.title: 13 cantos of hell: images from the divine comedy of Dante
results.creator_credit: Experimental Committee of the British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An animated film based on episodes from Dante’s Inferno. The film is the work of the young artist Peter King, who was formerly associated with Lotte Reininger, famous for her silhouette films. A similar technique is used in this film in which the animated figures have a sculptural form. They display a highly individual visual imagination complemented by compelling sound.
